page.title: 06ECOLOGY:HOLT,WORCS.
page.content: {FOOTPATHS.}The area,especially east of the Severn, has many of these which used to be living lines of communication through pastoral land.With changes in agriculture fewer are now needed by the farming community, so many are being re-routed to continue to give pleasure for recreation without interfering with farming practice.{WYCHAVON WAY } This was devised by Wychavon Council to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II as a recreational footpath to run eastwards to the Cotswolds starting at Holt Bridge. From there it follows the east bank of the Severn for one mile,then turns east by a track leading to the pond at Turn Mill,which lies S.W. of Ombersley Court.By Holt Bridge a large elm tree has survived Dutch Elm Disease.
